abstract.li: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of a data model that identifies activities, dependencies, durations and milestones associated with products described in the WBS. Includes the information necessary to produce Workflow Diagrams, Network Schedules, Gantt Charts and Resource Leveling.

purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of a data model that identifies activities, dependencies, durations and milestones associated with products described in the WBS. Includes the information necessary to produce Workflow Diagrams, Network Schedules, Gantt Charts and Resource Leveling.

From Systems Engineering encompasses the design and specification of systems, and the planning and management of the engineering processes that design, manufacture, field, and support that system. Within organizations and between organizations it is beneficial to be able to exchange plans and schedules. These may be at a high level where they deal with the tasks of work breakdown structure or at low and detailed level where they coordinate individual workers. This module captures information concerning schedules, resource allocation and leveling. That information is needed to manage the life cycle process of developing and using a system such that persons and organizations can coordinate their activities.
From This AP233 business case module is constructed from several ISO/TS Application modules.

The Activity Module captures the definition of an activity. An activity is a work element, function or task. It captures the relationship between two activities that might be on sequential, concurrent, or alternative paths. It captures the relationship between an activity and inputs and outputs from the activity, i.e. the product or activity data that it generates or uses.

The Activity as Realized Module captures planned or defined activities that will occur in the future. It captures the historical occurrence of an activity and the relationship of the planned activity to the actual historical occurrence of the activity.
The Activity Method Module captures identification and description of activity detail, such how the transformation occurs.
The Activity Method Assignment Module captures relationships between activity methods. It captures the assignment of activity methods to product data.
The Activity method implementation module provides the capability to associate additional information with an activity method.
The Attribute classification module provides the association of a value, represented by a class, to an attribute on an entity.
The Classification assignment module provides assignment of classification information to product or activity data.

The Condition Module captures the conditions that impact an activity or its execution. Condition is specified by a textual description with a logical result or by external entities as input to a condition expression. It captures the assignment of conditions to activities and relationships among conditions.
The Event Model captures the characterization of an event. It captures characterization of a relationship between two events and the characterization of an event with respect to another event.

purpose.p: The Process property assignment Module capture the specification of a property of an activity, the representation of a property of an activity, or the use of an independent property in the definition of an activity.

The Project Module captures the definition of a project and its responsible organization. It captures its planned and actual execution dates. It captures the association of a project to activity and product data and relationship between two projects.
The property assignment module provides for the:
purpose.ul: Assignment of a property to product data;
Use of an independent property in the definition of an item;
Association of a representation with a property.
purpose.p: The Resource as Realized Module captures the recording of resources used or consumed by activities. It captures the usage or consumption of actual resources and types of resource items. It captures the relationship between the resource actually applied and realized with the corresponding resource requirement statements. It captures the relationship between the resource as realized and the corresponding resource events.
The Resource Item Module captures the definition of a resource and the definition of a grouping of resources as a resource in its own right.

The Resource Management Module captures the availability of a resource. It captures the planning and recording of resource provision, the allocation and issuing of a resource, and the relationships between allocated resources and the corresponding resource requirements.

The Resource Property Assignment Module captures the definition of a property that may be associated with a resource or related element. It captures the representation of a property that may be associated with a resource or related element; the use of an independent property in the definition of a resource, and the means to assign a property to a resource or related element. The entity property includes time intervals.

The Scheme Module captures the identification of schemes that support the ordering of activities. It captures the identification of entries in a scheme, and the association of dates and times with schemes and entries in schemes. It captures the definition of relationships between entries within a scheme, including dependencies and sequencing. It captures the definition of relationships between schemes, and the definition of relationships between scheme entries and schemes that expand on entries.

The Task Specification Module captures the specification of a task as a sequence of instructions encoded as text. It captures the specification of a task as a structured set of instructions. It captures the association of pre-conditions to a task or a stage within a task, the association of post-conditions to a task or a stage within a task, and the assignment of a task.
